page.title: 02A COUNCILLOR IN BURTON
page.content: Roger Wright,a schoolmaster ,has been a Labour councillor on the Staffs. County Council for five years.He stood for Council in order to do his best for Burton Town,but first worked in more humble ways in his party branch. Mr.Wright keeps in touch with his division through telephone calls,by walking round the area,calling in pubs,and reading the paper.He works on Council business most evenings,and has even been called back from holiday to vote in Council. He attends many meetings,both of the full Council and of the Education Committee,but finds little gratitude for the hard work involved. He would like Central Goverment to interfere less in local spending,so that social services could be improved. His only political ambition is to be Leader of the Council.
